comment: Had him for CAE and loved it. Very picky on homework, assignments, etc. Just do your stuff on time. You WILL get counted off for little "mistakes" (notice the quotations). Have theory he gets more laid back the higher level the course. He was very chill with us, summer course too. He wasn't even present at the final, just left the test and his #.

Useless. Does not belong at a school like this. Has no clue how to teach. Good luck getting a straight forward answer to anything. Makes fun of students trying to be funny. he's not. Tells you what will be on his test and then doesn't even test you on that.

An embarrassment to the school. Takes personal agendas into account for your grade. Go into class sometimes, and he just sits there teaching himself the material he should be teaching us. I went into the class knowing a large amount of surface modeling as i work in the industry, but I'm pretty sure I'm retarded now. THANKS. Full of Himself.

I took him for Fall semester of 2011. The class itself isn't difficult as long as you go. The most annoying thing he assigns is homework about handwriting. He's not too helpful and in a way makes you feel like crap for asking questions. Also, he seems pretty lenient about when things are due espesially when the whole class didn't do the work.
Extremely picky on grading assignments, but doesn't give much work. OK if you've taken a similar course in HS, but watch out if you're only just now learning this stuff.

I took him right before I switched my major to chemistry. He seemed to like me alright until he asked me about my religious beliefs. He did not like that I was Muslim and claimed my god was just a "moon god." He also told a story about how this girl was cried when she failed his tests and he thought it was hillarious. Don't take him.

Good professor. I learned lots about CNC machining and GDT in his class. Lab was fun too. A little hard to get along with sometimes but he still grades fair and answers questions. Learned how to write "Memo-Styled" reports better than in TCOM and to use various measuring instruments in Metrology Lab. Got an "A" but had to study hard. Cool class...

Great teacher, easy class, made A's on all test, came to every class, turned in every assignment. Got a C in the class, along with most everyone in the class, and most were as shocked as I was. Went to get him to explain his grading system and he couldnt, AVOID HIM LIKE THE PLAGUE.

Manufacturing Process II. I've had Fleming three times. Worst professor in the MET department. Taking him is like gambling with your GPA. He's very unorganized witch affects his website, grading, and classes. Professor Sweigart, if you're reading this, FIRE HIM!!!

Professor Fleming is a good teacher, very easy as long as you keep up with work. He will go on tangents about odd stuff, and seems very cocky. Outside of that he isnt bad, does not care much about teaching.

This guy is the worst teacher ever.  No help combined with the fact he doesn't have a clue make class really pointless.  I could teach the class and know more about the subject than he does.  He really couldn't care less about the students education.  I've had him four times and he is the same in every class.  Should be fired.
In general, bad attitude.
This guy is obsessed with lettering. He teaches physics and puts all importance on handwriting and not physics.

He's a cool guy, but as a professor, he's a moron. His examples don't help. He can barely makes himself understood. But homework assignments are easy, quizes aren't hard, however test questions are phrased in a retarded kinda way so it's hard to understand what he's asking for. As long as you do your reading assignments, you're fine

He's a cool guy, but as a professor, he's a moron. His examples don't help. He can barely makes himself understood. But homework assignments are easy, quizes aren't hard, however test questions are phrased in a retarded kinda way so it's hard to understand what he's asking for. As long as you do your reading assignments, you're fine

Good Professor! was very willing to help out. Very flexable about coming to different class times if needed. Was always availible during office period. Kept the class entertained different scence of humor but i thought it was funny.

Worst professor I have ever had. If you ask him a question he pauses, looks at you and then tells you to answer it yourself. He offers no help and rarely seems like he wants to be there. If you are on his good side and he likes you then you can count on getting a better grade on a drawing than someone whom he doesnâ€™t care for, even if it is the sam
He is very smart but not a very good teacher!!

The class will teach more than the proffessor does.  Watch out for his quizes.  They are easy but his way of grading them is ****ed up.  He will tell you one thing and if u put that on a quiz he will change it the next day and then it's wrong.  He doesn't agree with the book and believes he's always right.  He'll probably **** you over...

Horrible teacher. "Didn't have time" to update grades, or put up study guides that he PROMISED to put online. Wastes time telling irrelevant stories. The class was a waste of time and what should have been an easy class became difficult because he was unfair about things. Take matricardi if you actually want to learn something and get a good grade.

By far the worst teacher i've ever had. If you can even give him the privledge of being called "teacher". He forgets what he teaches, then when he tries to use examples, the class normally has to teach HIM about what he's tryin to tell us about. The class is so boring that you don't pay attention and end up not doing as well. NEVER TAKE THIS MAN!
Not very clear on what he wants. Always makes exceptions to his mistakes.

Class was long and boring, but you have to go to it or you miss something and he makes you feel stupid for not having heard it.  Just didn't like the guy don't know what it is. Also test are B.S. nothing to do with in class discussion.  Take Conrey.

HORRIBLE !!!! dont tak unless you really want to fail. His test dont realte to the material that he talks about. His lectures can put anyone to sleep they are long and extremely boring. When asked for help he seems obligated and doesnt really help solve the problem.

one of the worst proffesors i have ever had if you ask him to help you... well then again dont bother because he's prolly to lazy to get up. worst of all is his grading scheme. If you try your hardest on drawing u probably wont get anything higher then a 8 out 10 then again if you hand in a half A@! drawing you will probabably get a 7 or a 6.

He does not teach you anything. He tells you how to teach yourself. He does not help you with anything just asks if you read or tried it or not. He does not seem like a teacher more like a bottle cap manufacturer. He has no structure in his class and does not seem to be prepared on what to teach each day.
Hard, Anal about work.

He was one of the worst and most unprepared Prof. I have ever had. When he was actually in the room he was unhelpful and seemed putout if asked questions.  The tests rarely tested important information but rather obscure details. He should go back to the business sector because it is obvious that he has no desire to be a teacher.

Easy class, He worked for Alcoa (designing bottle caps) so relates everything back to that. Overall, he is okay not sure if it`s because he`s not used to teaching and just needs to become accustomed to it

If you tryin his class he will give you a grade that reflects it, but he used to have a job in the bottle cap industry and he talks about it constantly wether it is relavant to the subject or not.  I would take another class with him.

I took this guys first semester of teaching. I wish he would have taught more, and he should have prepared more. I felt the class was too easy, but kids failed anyway... And he sure does like to talk about plastic bottle caps! :)
